page.title: 11TRANSPORT
page.content:
The main method of transport in this area is by road, but apart from the usual ones linking local areas there are also very important ones linking the region.
Firstly the M20, linking London to Folkestone, can be joined here. It is important for the area because it brings in tourism and industry from the rest of Europe.
Secondly the A249 links the M2 (London to Dover) to the M20, and North-East Kent to Maidstone.
Lastly there is the very historic Pilgrims Way, a route used since prehistoric times linking Winchester and Canterbury. Many settlements originated because of it.
